website_summaries.verdict: All the cushioning you'd expect from Mad Rock – quality construction and comfortable straps – in a convenient, portable tri-fold design.
pros: Made of open and closed cell foam
Measures 24 inches by 44 inches by 15 inches when closed
Measures 70 inches by 44 inches by 5 inches when opened
cons: May be too large to fit in smaller vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Great rock climbing pad. I was deciding between a double or a triple and I'm happy that I went with the triple. It is super light and easy to carry. I'm a 5'6 tall woman and have no problem scrambling over rocks with it on my back on the way to my bouldering spot. It's fairly stiff but I like it that way, and I have not rolled my ankle yet landing on it. I would definetly recommend this pad, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Need a big pad? Look into this!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect add-on for a fellow climber to carry. I use the Mad Rock R3, Mad Rock Duo, and the Mad Rock Triple Mad Pad to cover a large area when bouldering. The built in velcro attachment sleeves help fill the gaps with other Mad Rock pads, and this has been a very useful piece of equipment to round out covering large fall zones. Be aware that this does not have storage pockets, and is large. I generally have someone carry this separately, and have been very happy with the feel of the foam when climbing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Useless

customer_reviews.title: Love this mat!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I got this to use with my portable aerial rig. I teach and perform circus arts and this bigger portable mat is perfect for safety. I was looking at getting a crash pad BUT this is even better, light weight, portable for photo shoots and overall well built ! I also got this over a crash pad because of its dual use for luxury camping , as a 6ft tall person I needed something longer. If I could change anything it would be the color ;) Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid reliable mats for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Huge mat at the best value. Its thick and firm which is good for bouldering. If you want something a little softer, you could put a foam topper below or above it, or both. Just remember to bend your knees before letting go and falling. The sofa option on it is also surprisingly comfortable. I really hope they restock this. The Madrock website wont ship to Alaska, and i have to order it from Amazon. Please restock this so I can buy 2 more!!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine W.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: If you only want to lug around one pad or only want one, then this is a great choice! This thing might seem a bit expensive but the area is covers is well worth it. Its thick and designed perfect for what it's designed for. If everyone had one of these, bouldering might not be as scary ;)
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great portable protection
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pad. Definitely light weight to move around. We actually purchased to use underneath our kids American ninja Warrior course. My son is 10 and he can move the pad by himself. All of the kids have fallen really hard on it and it has definitely Absorbed the impact of their falls.
customer_reviews.author: EmR

customer_reviews.title: Good stitching, nice looking but would prefer sturdier fabric. All in all, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Typical Mad Rock quality. I use this as a bouldering pad, camp couch and spare mattress at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Crash Pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful crash pad. It's not squishy at all like I expected. It does well with falls. I use it for aerial fitness practices. It makes me feel much safer!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Great pads, will prevent injuries
customer_reviews.text: While they are not cheap, the are definitely going to cut down on injuries. And then, isn't that the most important goal?
customer_reviews.author: Straight Talker

customer_reviews.title: i love it. it doesn't fit in my car however
customer_reviews.text: sooooo big! i love it. it doesn't fit in my car however... so i do need to figure out a solution for that.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my Grandson and he was thrilled. He has used it once and plans to take it to Colorado next week.
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: No broken bones
customer_reviews.text: Quality crash pad. Saved me from breaking my ankles just as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Riley S

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. LARGE.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it on my garage training wall at this point, but the size is great (large), it's easy to use, and has a nice cushioned but still firm surface. Would recommend to those where the overall size is important.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vuto

customer_reviews.title: Great pad. Being around 6 inches in length I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pad. The pad being around 6 feet in length, I have been able to boulder with it by day and sleep two adults on it at night.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: No troubles!
customer_reviews.text: I've seen no troubles with these pads thus far. I took a bouldering trip to Boulder, CO and slept in a tent on the pads for two weeks. The pads were totally acceptable for sleeping, if you don't mind a little stiffness in your mattress. For me they were great --- I actually slept two people on them, me and my significant other. As for climbing, I don't see any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bien

customer_reviews.title: would be 5 stars except for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great mat, lots of protection. Overpriced though, in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: jfgoodysr

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love it for our rock climbing wall. It's thick and can absorb a hit.
customer_reviews.author: Equatorialthoughts

product_meta.title: Mad Rock Triple Mad Pad
product_meta.description: The crash pad of choice for climbers worldwide who don't want to sacrifice financial security on the next send. The Mad Pad is a plush five inch thick combination of open and closed cell foam for firm but comfortable drops. Backpack straps make a breeze to tote in. EZ attachment straps connect securely to other Mad Pads for the ultimate landing zone. Ready to take a load off? Lean back and relax - their aircraft aluminum buckle closure and specially designed straps allow you to convert the Mad Pad right into your own lounge chair. Folded 4' x 3' x 5".
